feed.title: A critique of bitcoin open source community

entry.title: A critique of bitcoin open source community
entry.summary: The provided links lead to an interesting article on "Open Collaboration and Peer Production" from the University of California, Berkeley. The author, Nathan Merrill, discusses the principles behind successful open collaboration efforts and identifies key factors that contribute to their success. He emphasizes the importance of clear communication and transparency, as well as the need for a shared vision and goals among participants. Additionally, the author highlights the benefits of peer production, including increased creativity and innovation, as well as the potential for greater efficiency and cost savings. He also notes some challenges that may arise in such endeavors, such as conflicts over intellectual property and power dynamics within the group. The link to Mitar's personal website showcases his work and interests in various areas, including software development and blockchain technology. A link to his Twitter account is also provided.
